results.adx_keywords: Child Custody and Support;Elections, Senate;Walker, Herschel;Republican Party;Georgia
results.title: Herschel Walker, Critic of Absentee Fathers, Has a Second Son He Doesn’t See
results.abstract: The football star and G.O.P. Senate candidate has often praised his relationship with his 22-year-old son, Christian. Left unmentioned: He also has a 10-year-old son.

media.caption: Herschel Walker, the Republican nominee for Senate from Georgia, at a rally last month.

results.adx_keywords: Delays (Transportation);Airlines and Airplanes;Travel and Vacations;Lost and Found Property;Airports;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Summer (Season);Europe
results.title: Hold Onto Your Hats (and Bags). Travelers to Europe Face Chaos.
results.abstract: Hours in security lines. Canceled flights. Lost baggage. Here’s a look at how you could be affected by travel disruptions this summer and tips on how to prepare.

media.caption: At Amsterdam’s Schiphol airport, passengers waited up to six hours in security lines earlier this month.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Web Browsers;Chrome (Browser);Windows (Operating System);Microsoft Corp
results.title: Internet Explorer Is Shutting Down in a Burst of Nostalgia
results.abstract: Microsoft will be disabling IE and directing Windows users to its modern Edge web browser in coming months. The news inspired jokes, memes and even some fond memories.

media.caption: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, introducing the latest version of the company’s Internet Explorer web browser in San Francisco in 1997.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Alopecia Areata;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Hair;Eli Lilly and Company;Food and Drug Administration;New England Journal of Medicine
results.title: F.D.A. Approves Alopecia Drug That Restores Hair Growth in Many Patients
results.abstract: The drug, made by Eli Lilly, is already used for rheumatoid arthritis, and could be followed by two more drugs from other companies.

media.caption: Patients from the clinical trials, before and after 36 weeks of treatment with baricitinib.

results.byline: By Isaac Aronow and Doug Mennella
results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Pence, Mike;Trump, Donald J;Eastman, John C;Luttig, J Michael;Jacob, Gregory F (1974- );House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Lawyer Cited ‘Heated Fight’ Among Justices Over Election Suits
results.abstract: In an email weeks after the election, another lawyer advising the Trump campaign responded that the prospect of “‘wild’ chaos” on Jan. 6 could lead the Supreme Court to take up a case.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The pro-Trump lawyer John Eastman, left, and Rudolph W. Giuliani at a rally near the White House on Jan. 6, 2021. In an email, Mr. Eastman claimed to have insight into an internal fight at the Supreme Court.

results.adx_keywords: Transgender and Transsexuals;Gender;Teenagers and Adolescence;Psychology and Psychologists;Discrimination;Medicine and Health;Youth;Mental Health and Disorders
results.title: The Battle Over Gender Therapy
results.abstract: More teenagers than ever are seeking transitions, but the medical community that treats them is deeply divided about why — and what to do to help them.

media.copyright: Anne Vetter for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Bitcoin (Currency);Virtual Currency;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Computers and the Internet;Workplace Environment;Start-ups;Powell, Jesse (Cryptocurrency Executive);Kraken (Payward Inc);Coinbase Inc
results.byline: By Ryan Mac and David Yaffe-Bellany
results.title: Inside a Corporate Culture War Stoked by a Crypto C.E.O.
results.abstract: Jesse Powell, who leads the crypto exchange Kraken, has challenged the use of preferred pronouns, debated who can use racial slurs and called American women “brainwashed.”

media.caption: Jesse Powell, chief executive of Kraken, at the company’s office in San Francisco in 2014.

results.adx_keywords: Traffic Accidents and Safety;Driverless and Semiautonomous Vehicles;Automobile Safety Features and Defects;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Tesla Motors Inc;National Highway Traffic Safety Administration
results.byline: By Neal E. Boudette, Cade Metz and Jack Ewing
results.title: Tesla Autopilot and Other Driver-Assist Systems Linked to Hundreds of Crashes
results.abstract: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration released data on 10 months of crashes involving cars with automated components. A few were fatal.

media.caption: Tesla Autopilot is among the advanced driver-assistance systems being scrutinized by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

results.title: Lizzo’s Lyric Offended Fans. She Changed It, and They Forgave.
results.abstract: The song “Grrrls” was released Friday and updated Monday to remove a derogatory term for people with disabilities, which she said she did not use with an intent to offend.

media.caption: Lizzo in 2021. “I never want to promote derogatory language,” she said.

results.adx_keywords: Virtual Currency;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Bitcoin (Currency);Banking and Financial Institutions;Computers and the Internet;Start-ups;Coinbase Inc;Celsius Network LLC
results.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Erin Griffith
results.title: ‘The Music Has Stopped’: Crypto Firms Quake as Prices Fall
results.abstract: Crypto companies are laying off staff, freezing withdrawals and trying to stem losses, raising questions about the health of the ecosystem.

media.caption: Employees of Coinbase in Times Square last year for its initial public offering. On Tuesday, the company said that it was laying off 18 percent of its workers.
media.copyright: Gabby Jones for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Floods;Rain;Landslides and Mudslides;Evacuations and Evacuees;National Parks, Monuments and Seashores;Roads and Traffic;Yellowstone National Park;Montana;Wyoming;Gardiner (Mont)
results.byline: By Alex Traub, Livia Albeck-Ripka and Christine Hauser
results.title: Yellowstone Park, Staggered by Rain and Floods, Will Stay Closed for Days
results.abstract: Parts of the national park may stay off-limits for the rest of the season. Visitors were evacuated after record rainfall washed away roads and bridges, the authorities said.

media.caption: Parts of the highway between Gardiner and Mammoth in Montana were washed out on Monday.
media.copyright: Larry Mayer/The Billings Gazette, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: internal-open-access;Homeless Persons;Group Homes and Supportive Housing;Affordable Housing;audio-neutral-immersive;Parker, Annise D;Turner, Sylvester;Coalition for the Homeless;Austin (Tex)
results.byline: By Michael Kimmelman, Lucy Tompkins and Christopher Lee
results.title: How Houston Moved 25,000 People From the Streets Into Homes of Their Own
results.abstract: The nation’s fourth-largest city hasn’t solved homelessness, but its remarkable progress can suggest a way forward.

media.copyright: Christopher Lee for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Holocaust and the Nazi Era;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Flags, Emblems and Insignia;Kammerzell, Derek;Kent (Wash.)
results.title: Officer Who Displayed Nazi Insignia Will Receive $1.5 Million to Resign
results.abstract: Derek Kammerzell, an assistant police chief in Kent, Wash., was investigated and disciplined after he taped the insignia of an SS officer to his office door in September 2020.

media.caption: Chief Kammerzell said he embraced the nickname the “German General” because of his German heritage, according to an investigation.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;Midterm Elections (2022);Flores, Mayra (1986- );Republican Party;Texas
results.title: Republicans flip a Democratic-held House seat in South Texas, at least for now.
results.abstract: The district in the border city of Brownsville has sent Democrats to Congress for years.

media.caption: Mayra Flores, right, a Republican running in a special election for a House seat in South Texas, joined a parade in February in Brownsville.
media.copyright: Jason Garza for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: National Parks, Monuments and Seashores;Floods;Weather;Rain;Yellowstone National Park;Livingston (Mont)
results.title: Photos of Flooding Damage in Yellowstone
results.abstract: Flooding and mudslides from recent storms have collapsed bridges and washed away roads in the national park.

media.copyright: Jacob W. Frank/NPS, via Associated Press

results.title: Brutal Beating of Women in China Highlights Risk of Saying ‘No’
results.abstract: Graphic footage of an attack in a restaurant fueled online debate that showed both the growing awareness of women’s rights and how divisive feminism still remains.

media.caption: A still image taken from a video showing two women lying on the ground after being assaulted by a group of men outside a restaurant in the northeastern city of Tangshan, China, in June.

results.adx_keywords: Floods;Weather;Landslides and Mudslides;Global Warming;Yellowstone National Park;Montana
results.byline: By Jim Robbins, Thomas Fuller and Christine Chung
results.title: Flooding Chaos in Yellowstone, a Sign of Crises to Come
results.abstract: Record rainfall and mudslides forced closures just as tourism season ramped up. Virtually none of America’s national parks are untouched by extreme weather and climate change.

media.caption: The Yellowstone River flooding parts of Paradise Valley, a northern corridor to Yellowstone National Park.

results.title: Five Blunt Truths About the War in Ukraine
results.abstract: It’s time for Biden to take greater risks for victory.
